Sikh Women’s Aid – National Survey 2024

Introduction Sikh Women’s Aid is a charity supporting women and children from the Sikh Panjabi Community. #HerFreedomScotland – amplifying experiences of domestic abuse in Scotland

Every year over 60,000 domestic abuse cases are recorded by police across Scotland. This is just the tip of the iceberg and signals a nationwide tragedy that demands attention. Participate in #HerFreedomScotland and help us build a groundswell of voices calling for improved responses to domestic abuse. Conviction rate for rape is the lowest for any crime type in Scotland – Rape Crisis Scotland

The conviction rate for rape and attempted rape was, for the 10th year in a row, the lowest for any crime type in Scotland in 2021-22. Just 48% of rape cases that made it to court in 2021-22 resulted in a conviction. The overall conviction rate in Scotland for the same year was 88%. The conviction rate for rape has…

Guidance on when adverts can be discriminatory – Equality and Human Rights Commission

Introduction This guidance explains what a discriminatory advert is and how to make a complaint if you think you have been discriminated against. Placing or publishing a discriminatory advert is unlawful under the Equality Act 2010 (‘the Act’). The Act protects individuals from being discriminated against because of a protected characteristic.
